# 9.1. Autocorrelation

Correlograms, marginal change, lagged values (detrending and differencing).

## Pollution in Beijing

[An example with Twitter, using Beijing pollution data](http://brainchronicle.blogspot.co.uk/2012/07/twitter-analysis-of-air-pollution-in.html). There was a [pollution peak](http://brainchronicle.blogspot.fr/2013/01/air-quality-analysis-from-beijing.html) in January 2013. The city [looks like](http://kateoplis.tumblr.com/post/40555052298/nope-this-is-not-a-still-from-blade-runner-its) *Blade Runner*, and its ongoing [Smog-ocalypse](http://simplystatistics.org/2013/01/14/welcome-to-the-smog-ocalypse/) means that staying in Beijing is like [smoking between one and half and three cigarettes a day](http://simplystatistics.org/2011/12/14/smoking-is-a-choice-breathing-is-not/).
